pageContext.claim: “I'm the only President, in 51 years, that lowered -- last year, drug prices went down a little bit. Not much, but a little bit.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump overstates what happened to the consumer price index for prescription drugs. It fell by 0.6 percent for the 12 months ending Dec. 2018, the first time in 46 years, not over 50 years. Moreover, the Bureau of Labor Statistics says there are other 12-month periods with index declines including one as recently as 2013. Prices rose 3 percent in the 12-month period ending Dec. 2019, and then kept rising after that. Trump also often falsely suggests this would not have ever happened under Democrats -- when in fact it did. GoodRx, an online prescription cost service, found in September 2020 that drug prices are surging faster than any other medical service or good, increasing by 33 percent since 2014.
